The name can\'t be that long
A squat is a physical exercise that is carried out to develop the muscles and strengthen the tendons and ligaments of the legs. It also allows to tone the buttocks and provides benefits to the hip.

Abdominal exercises serve to strengthen the abdominal muscles. Toning the abdomen not only favors aesthetics, but also a much more energetic and disease-free body is achieved. The abdominals are a group of special muscles and form the central part of the body.

They are a good way to develop our oblique abdominals, frontal and improve our body coordination. They are a good way to also congest the abdominal area, although let\'s not fool ourselves, being an abdominal movement more complex at the level of execution than others, they will be more difficult for us to perform.
It involves jumping by opening your legs and raising your arms until your hands touch above your head and jumping again by joining your feet and placing your arms at your sides parallel to your body.

It is an isometric torso exercise that consists of maintaining a difficult position for a prolonged period of time. The most common plank is the front or forearm plank, which is done in a pushup position with your body weight supported by your forearms, elbows, and toes.

Elbow flexion is an exercise that involves the elbows, also known as push-ups, plank, push-up or simply flexion, it is a physical exercise performed while in an inclined position, lying down, lifting the body only with the arms and lowering back to the I usually.
